item.description: Red Line vs Pedestrian; INC#1370; 07:29PM; 6250r W Hollywood Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3rNHRKl; Hollywood; A pedestrian reportedly jumped onto the train from the platform and went through the window into the cab of the train. There are two patients being transported: 1 in critical condition and one with minor, non-life threatening injuries (was on the train). Age/gender unknown at this time. Any further questions are referred to LAPD Inc# 4100 and LA County Sheriff's. The original 9-1-1 call was received at 6:53PM. No further details.; FS 27; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC13 BC18 E229 E235 E261 E35 E41 E61 E76 EM11 HR3 RA41 RA76 SQ21 T29 T35 T61; CH7; 15; Margaret Stewart

Confined Space - FATALITY; INC#1085; 04:48PM; 5917 W Burchard Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3pI1TmH; Mid-City; Patient (age / gender unknown at this time) was located in an overpass void space and determined dead on scene. LA County Coroner and LAPD (Inc #3318) will handle identification and cause of death determination. LAFD Urban Search and Rescue Task Force may be required to assist in removing body - TBD by Coroner. Original 9-1-1 call received at 3:51PM. No further details.; FS 68; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC5 E227 E5 E68 HR3 T27 UR27 UR88; CH4; Margaret Stewart

Update Structure Fire; INC#1589; 01:31PM; 8142 N Sunland Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3y3f2uu; Sun Valley; In mostly defensive operations, for over two hours, 87 firefighters battled flames with at least four ladder pipes and several other heavy streams in operation on the commercial building with one-story and two-story portions. The bulk of the fire is knocked down, however it will be an extended operation to access the remaining pockets of fire within the debris. LAFD Heavy Equipment has been called to the incident to assist. Other crews are being released to reduce the number of personnel committed. No reported injuries. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 77; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 BC12 BC14 BC5 CM42 E227 E239 E24 E260 E273 E274 E288 E289 E298 E35 E75 E77 E88 E89 E90 EA1 EM14 HE1 HR3 RA77 RA89 RA98 T27 T39 T60 T73 T74 T88 T89 T98 UR27 UR88; CH9; 17 18; Nicholas Prange

Update Structure Fire; INC#1589; 11:50PM; 8142 N Sunland Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3y3f2uu; Sun Valley; Due to the dilapidated condition of the previously burned structure, crews are withdrawing from the interior and defensive firefighting tactics will be used. Crews outside are setting up heavy streams, including ladder pipes, to continue fighting this fire.; FS 77; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 BC12 BC14 BC5 CM42 E227 E24 E260 E274 E288 E289 E298 E75 E77 E88 E89 EM14 HR3 RA77 T27 T60 T74 T88 T89 T98 UR27 UR88; CH9; 17 18; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1589; 11:30PM; 8142 N Sunland Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3y3f2uu; Sun Valley; Vacant one-story commercial with heavy fire showing (site of previous burn). Offensive mode.; FS 77; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC12 BC14 E24 E260 E289 E298 E77 E89 T60 T89 T98; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

Shooting; INC#1236; 04:46PM; 800 block of N Eubank Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3DwASYy; Wilmington; Reported shooting with two patients (11-year-old male critical condition and 25-year-old female moderate condition) transported by LAFD firefighter-paramedics to a local trauma center. Unknown if this is connected to LAFD Inc # 1235. LAPD Inc # 3224. Nothing further.; FS 38; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC13 E285 E38 E49 RA101 RA38 RA79 T85; CH4; 13; Nicholas Prange

Unknown if this is connected to LAFD Inc # 1236. LAPD Inc # 3240. Nothing further.; FS 38; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC6 E238 E49 RA112 T38; CH4; 12; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0928; 02:15PM; 2955 S Normandie Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3otnwYy; Adams-Normandie; Firefighters located fire in the walls and attic of a 3,003 sq-ft two-story multi-family residence built in 1905. Firefighters performed a coordinated effort between interior fire attack and rooftop ventilation. It took 47 firefighters 20 minutes to access, confine, and extinguish the flames, without injury. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 15; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC1 BC11 BC13 CM22 E13 E15 E210 E215 E226 E26 E34 EA1 EM11 RA15 RA34 RA815 SQ21 T10 T15 T26; CH9; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0928; 01:55PM; 2955 S Normandie Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3otnwYy; Adams-Normandie; Two-story duplex with heavy smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 15; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC1 BC11 BC13 CM22 E13 E15 E210 E215 E226 E26 E34 EM11 RA15 RA34 RA815 SQ21 T10 T15 T26; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0321; 12:04PM; 14335 W Sherman Wy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Ip6uCS; Van Nuys; LAFD crews on scene of a law enforcement standby noticed smoke, and subsequently fire, coming from a third-floor unit of a three-story center-hallway apartment building at 11:40 AM, and upgraded the assignment to a structure fire response. Forty-two firefighters engaged in fire attack to confine the fire to the unit of origin, and extinguish the flames in 24 minutes, however smoke and water damage were more widespread than the fire damage. Firefighters assisted some residents with evacuation, and instructed others to shelter in place (remain in their unit with doors closed). One adult male patient in LAPD custody was transported to an area hospital with burn injuries. Several pets were affected: at least two felines deceased, others injured and fled, and one canine suffered smoke inhalation. Firefighters supported the canine until animal services arrived. The cause of the fire is under active investigation. MEDIA: PIO Firefighter David Ortiz is on scene for media needs. If media response will be delayed, please communicate that with LAFD Media Desk.; FS 81; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; AR1 BC10 BC12 CM42 E239 E290 E39 E81 E89 PI2 RA81 RA881 RA89 T39 T90 TL1 TM2 TM3; CH8; 12 18; Nicholas Prange
